member.name: T:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding
member.summary: Base class for bindings in Xamarin.iOS and Xamarin.Android.

member.name: F:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding.TopSource
member.summary: The source at the "top" of the property chain.

member.name: F:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding.TopTarget
member.summary: The target at the "top" of the property chain.

member.name: P:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding.Mode
member.summary: The mode of the binding. OneTime means that the target property will be set once (when the binding is created) but that subsequent changes will be ignored. OneWay means that the target property will be set, and if the PropertyChanged event is raised by the source, the target property will be updated. TwoWay means that the source property will also be updated if the target raises the PropertyChanged event. Default means OneWay if only the source implements INPC, and TwoWay if both the source and the target implement INPC.

member.name: P:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding.Source
member.summary: Gets the source object for the binding.

member.name: P:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding.Target
member.summary: Gets the target object for the binding.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding.Detach
member.summary: Instructs the Binding instance to stop listening to value changes and to remove all listeneners.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding.ForceUpdateValueFromSourceToTarget
member.summary: Forces the Binding's value to be reevaluated. The target value will be set to the source value.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding.ForceUpdateValueFromTargetToSource
member.summary: Forces the Binding's value to be reevaluated. The source value will be set to the target value.

member.name: E:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding.ValueChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the value of the databound property changes.

member.name: T:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding`2
member.summary: Creates a binding between two properties. If the source implements INotifyPropertyChanged, the source property raises the PropertyChanged event and the BindingMode is OneWay or TwoWay, the target property will be synchronized with the source property. If the target implements INotifyPropertyChanged, the target property raises the PropertyChanged event and the BindingMode is TwoWay, the source property will also be synchronized with the target property.
member.typeparam: The type of the source property that is being databound.

The type of the target property that is being databound. If the source type is not the same as the target type, an automatic conversion will be attempted. However only simple types can be converted. For more complex conversions, use the and methods to define custom converters.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding`2.UpdateSourceTrigger
member.summary: Define that the binding should be evaluated when the bound control's source property changes. Because Xamarin controls are not DependencyObjects, the bound property will not automatically update the binding attached to it. Instead, use this method to specify that the binding must be updated when the property changes.
member.remarks:
This method should only be used with the following items:
- an EditText control and its Text property (TextChanged event).
- a CompoundButton control and its Checked property (CheckedChange event).
member.exception: When this method is called on a OneTime binding. Such bindings cannot be updated. This exception can also be thrown when the source object is null or has already been garbage collected before this method is called.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding`2.UpdateSourceTrigger(GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.UpdateTriggerMode)
member.summary: Define when the binding should be evaluated when the bound source object is a control. Because Xamarin controls are not DependencyObjects, the bound property will not automatically update the binding attached to it. Instead, use this method to define which of the control's events should be observed.
member.param:
Defines the binding's update mode. Use to update the binding when the source control loses the focus. You can also use to update the binding when the source control's property changes. The PropertyChanged mode should only be used with the following items:
- an EditText control and its Text property (TextChanged event).
- a CompoundButton control and its Checked property (CheckedChange event).
member.exception: When this method is called on a OneTime binding. Such bindings cannot be updated. This exception can also be thrown when the source object is null or has already been garbage collected before this method is called.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding`2.UpdateTargetTrigger
member.summary: Define that the binding should be evaluated when the bound control's target property changes. Because Xamarin controls are not DependencyObjects, the bound property will not automatically update the binding attached to it. Instead, use this method to specify that the binding must be updated when the property changes.
member.remarks:
This method should only be used with the following items:
- an EditText control and its Text property (TextChanged event).
- a CompoundButton control and its Checked property (CheckedChange event).
member.exception: When this method is called on a OneTime or a OneWay binding. This exception can also be thrown when the target object is null or has already been garbage collected before this method is called.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding`2.UpdateTargetTrigger(GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.UpdateTriggerMode)
member.summary: Define when the binding should be evaluated when the bound target object is a control. Because Xamarin controls are not DependencyObjects, the bound property will not automatically update the binding attached to it. Instead, use this method to define which of the control's events should be observed.
member.param:
Defines the binding's update mode. Use to update the binding when the source control loses the focus. You can also use to update the binding when the source control's property changes. The PropertyChanged mode should only be used with the following items:
- an EditText control and its Text property (TextChanged event).
- a CompoundButton control and its Checked property (CheckedChange event).
member.exception: When this method is called on a OneTime or a OneWay binding. This exception can also be thrown when the source object is null or has already been garbage collected before this method is called.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding`2.UpdateSourceTrigger(System.String)
member.summary: Define when the binding should be evaluated when the bound source object is a control. Because Xamarin controls are not DependencyObjects, the bound property will not automatically update the binding attached to it. Instead, use this method to define which of the control's events should be observed.
member.param: The name of the event that should be observed to update the binding's value.
member.exception: When this method is called on a OneTime binding. Such bindings cannot be updated. This exception can also be thrown when the source object is null or has already been garbage collected before this method is called.
When the eventName parameter is null or is an empty string.
When the requested event does not exist on the source control.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding`2.UpdateSourceTrigger``1(System.String)
member.summary: Define when the binding should be evaluated when the bound source object is a control. Because Xamarin controls are not DependencyObjects, the bound property will not automatically update the binding attached to it. Instead, use this method to define which of the control's events should be observed.
member.remarks: Use this method when the event requires a specific EventArgs type instead of the standard EventHandler.
member.typeparam: The type of the EventArgs used by this control's event.
member.param: The name of the event that should be observed to update the binding's value.
member.exception: When this method is called on a OneTime binding. Such bindings cannot be updated. This exception can also be thrown when the source object is null or has already been garbage collected before this method is called.
When the eventName parameter is null or is an empty string.
When the requested event does not exist on the source control.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding`2.UpdateTargetTrigger(System.String)
member.summary: Define when the binding should be evaluated when the bound target object is a control. Because Xamarin controls are not DependencyObjects, the bound property will not automatically update the binding attached to it. Instead, use this method to define which of the control's events should be observed.
member.param: The name of the event that should be observed to update the binding's value.
member.exception: When this method is called on a OneTime or a OneWay binding. This exception can also be thrown when the source object is null or has already been garbage collected before this method is called.
When the eventName parameter is null or is an empty string.
When the requested event does not exist on the target control.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding`2.UpdateTargetTrigger``1(System.String)
member.summary: Define when the binding should be evaluated when the bound target object is a control. Because Xamarin controls are not DependencyObjects, the bound property will not automatically update the binding attached to it. Instead, use this method to define which of the control's events should be observed.
member.remarks: Use this method when the event requires a specific EventArgs type instead of the standard EventHandler.
member.typeparam: The type of the EventArgs used by this control's event.
member.param: The name of the event that should be observed to update the binding's value.
member.exception: When this method is called on a OneTime or OneWay binding. This exception can also be thrown when the target object is null or has already been garbage collected before this method is called.
When the eventName parameter is null or is an empty string.
When the requested event does not exist on the target control.

member.name: P:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding`2.FallbackValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the value to use when the binding is unable to return a value. This can happen if one of the items on the Path (except the source property itself) is null, or if the Converter throws an exception.

member.name: P:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding`2.TargetNullValue
member.summary: Gets of sets the value used when the source property is null (or equals to default(TSource)).

member.name: P:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding`2.Value
member.summary: Gets the current value of the binding.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding`2.#ctor(System.Object,System.String,System.Object,System.String,GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.BindingMode,`0,`0)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Binding class for which the source and target properties are located in different objects.
member.param: The source of the binding. If this object implements INotifyPropertyChanged and the BindingMode is OneWay or TwoWay, the target will be notified of changes to the target property.
The name of the source property for the binding.
The target of the binding. If this object implements INotifyPropertyChanged and the BindingMode is TwoWay, the source will be notified of changes to the source property.
The name of the target property for the binding.

The mode of the binding. OneTime means that the target property will be set once (when the binding is created) but that subsequent changes will be ignored. OneWay means that the target property will be set, and if the PropertyChanged event is raised by the source, the target property will be updated. TwoWay means that the source property will also be updated if the target raises the PropertyChanged event. Default means OneWay if only the source implements INPC, and TwoWay if both the source and the target implement INPC.
Tthe value to use when the binding is unable to return a value. This can happen if one of the items on the Path (except the source property itself) is null, or if the Converter throws an exception.
The value to use when the binding is unable to return a value. This can happen if one of the items on the Path (except the source property itself) is null, or if the Converter throws an exception.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding`2.#ctor(System.Object,System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0}},System.Object,System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`1}},GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.BindingMode,`0,`0)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Binding class for which the source and target properties are located in different objects.
member.param: The source of the binding. If this object implements INotifyPropertyChanged and the BindingMode is OneWay or TwoWay, the target will be notified of changes to the target property.
An expression pointing to the source property. It can be a simple expression "() => [source].MyProperty" or a composed expression "() => [source].SomeObject.SomeOtherObject.SomeProperty".
The target of the binding. If this object implements INotifyPropertyChanged and the BindingMode is TwoWay, the source will be notified of changes to the source property.
An expression pointing to the target property. It can be a simple expression "() => [target].MyProperty" or a composed expression "() => [target].SomeObject.SomeOtherObject.SomeProperty".

The mode of the binding. OneTime means that the target property will be set once (when the binding is created) but that subsequent changes will be ignored. OneWay means that the target property will be set, and if the PropertyChanged event is raised by the source, the target property will be updated. TwoWay means that the source property will also be updated if the target raises the PropertyChanged event. Default means OneWay if only the source implements INPC, and TwoWay if both the source and the target implement INPC.
Tthe value to use when the binding is unable to return a value. This can happen if one of the items on the Path (except the source property itself) is null, or if the Converter throws an exception.
The value to use when the binding is unable to return a value. This can happen if one of the items on the Path (except the source property itself) is null, or if the Converter throws an exception.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding`2.ConvertSourceToTarget(System.Func{`0,`1})
member.summary: Defines a custom conversion method for a binding. To be used when the binding's source property is of a different type than the binding's target property, and the conversion cannot be done automatically (simple values).
member.param: A func that will be called with the source property's value, and will return the target property's value. IMPORTANT: Note that closures are not supported at the moment due to the use of WeakActions (see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/25730530/).

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding`2.ConvertTargetToSource(System.Func{`1,`0})
member.summary: Defines a custom conversion method for a two-way binding. To be used when the binding's target property is of a different type than the binding's source property, and the conversion cannot be done automatically (simple values).
member.param: A func that will be called with the source property's value, and will return the target property's value. IMPORTANT: Note that closures are not supported at the moment due to the use of WeakActions (see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/25730530/).
member.remarks: This method is inactive on OneTime or OneWay bindings.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding`2.Detach
member.summary: Instructs the Binding instance to stop listening to value changes and to remove all listeneners.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding`2.ForceUpdateValueFromSourceToTarget
member.summary: Forces the Binding's value to be reevaluated. The target value will be set to the source value.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding`2.ForceUpdateValueFromTargetToSource
member.summary: Forces the Binding's value to be reevaluated. The source value will be set to the target value.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding`2.ObserveSourceEvent(System.String)
member.summary: Define when the binding should be evaluated when the bound source object is a control. Because Xamarin controls are not DependencyObjects, the bound property will not automatically update the binding attached to it. Instead, use this method to define which of the control's events should be observed.
member.param: The name of the event that should be observed to update the binding's value.
member.exception: When this method is called on a OneTime binding. Such bindings cannot be updated. This exception can also be thrown when the source object is null or has already been garbage collected before this method is called.
When the eventName parameter is null or is an empty string.
When the requested event does not exist on the source control.

When the requested event does not exist on the source control.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding`2.WhenSourceChanges(System.Action)
member.summary: Defines an action that will be executed every time that the binding value changes.
member.param: The action that will be executed when the binding changes. IMPORTANT: Note that closures are not supported at the moment due to the use of WeakActions (see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/25730530/).
member.exception: When WhenSourceChanges is called on a binding which already has a target property set.

member.name: T:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.BindingMode
member.summary: The mode of the .

member.name: F:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.BindingMode.Default
member.summary: A default binding is a one way binding.

member.name: F:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.BindingMode.OneTime
member.summary: A one time binding. The binding's value will be set when the binding is created but subsequent changes will be ignored/

member.name: F:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.BindingMode.OneWay
member.summary: A one way binding, where the changes to the source property will update the target property, but changes to the target property don't affect the source property.

member.name: F:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.BindingMode.TwoWay
member.summary: A two way binding, where the changes to the source property will update the target property, and vice versa.

member.name: T:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.ExtensionsAndroid
member.summary: Defines extension methods for Android only.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.ExtensionsAndroid.GetAdapter``1(System.Collections.ObjectModel.ObservableCollection{``0},System.Func{System.Int32,``0,Android.Views.View,Android.Views.View})
member.summary: Creates a new for a given .
member.typeparam: The type of the items contained in the .
member.param: The collection that the adapter will be created for.

A method taking an item's position in the list, the item itself, and a recycled Android View, and returning an adapted View for this item. Note that the recycled view might be null, in which case a new View must be inflated by this method.
member.returns: A View adapted for the item passed as parameter.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.ExtensionsAndroid.GetAdapter``1(System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0},System.Func{System.Int32,``0,Android.Views.View,Android.Views.View})
member.summary: Creates a new for a given .
member.typeparam: The type of the items contained in the .
member.param: The list that the adapter will be created for.

A method taking an item's position in the list, the item itself, and a recycled Android , and returning an adapted View for this item. Note that the recycled View might be null, in which case a new View must be inflated by this method.
member.returns: An adapter adapted to the collection passed in parameter..

member.name: T:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Extensions
member.summary: Defines extension methods used to add data bindings and commands between Xamarin Android and iOS elements.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Extensions.SetBinding``2(System.Object,System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0}},System.Object,System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``1}},GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.BindingMode,``0,``0)
member.summary: Sets a data binding between two properties. If the source implements INotifyPropertyChanged, the source property raises the PropertyChanged event and the BindingMode is OneWay or TwoWay, the target property will be synchronized with the source property. If the target implements INotifyPropertyChanged, the target property raises the PropertyChanged event and the BindingMode is TwoWay, the source property will also be synchronized with the target property.
member.remarks: This class allows for a different TSource and TTarget and is able to perform simple type conversions automatically. This is useful if the source property and the target property are of different type. If the type conversion is complex, please use the and methods to configure the binding. It is very possible that TSource and TTarget are the same type in which case no conversion occurs.
member.typeparam: The type of the property that is being databound before conversion.
The type of the property that is being databound after conversion.
member.param: The target of the binding. If this object implements INotifyPropertyChanged and the BindingMode is TwoWay, the source will be notified of changes to the source property.
An expression pointing to the target property. It can be a simple expression "() => [target].MyProperty" or a composed expression "() => [target].SomeObject.SomeOtherObject.SomeProperty".
The source of the binding. If this object implements INotifyPropertyChanged and the BindingMode is OneWay or TwoWay, the target will be notified of changes to the target property.
An expression pointing to the source property. It can be a simple expression "() => [source].MyProperty" or a composed expression "() => [source].SomeObject.SomeOtherObject.SomeProperty".

The mode of the binding. OneTime means that the target property will be set once (when the binding is created) but that subsequent changes will be ignored. OneWay means that the target property will be set, and if the PropertyChanged event is raised by the source, the target property will be updated. TwoWay means that the source property will also be updated if the target raises the PropertyChanged event. Default means OneWay if only the source implements INPC, and TwoWay if both the source and the target implement INPC.
The value to use when the binding is unable to return a value. This can happen if one of the items on the Path (except the source property itself) is null, or if the Converter throws an exception.
The value used when the source property is null (or equals to default(TSource)).

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Extensions.SetBinding``1(System.Object,System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0}},GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.BindingMode,``0,``0)
member.summary:
Creates a with a source property but without a target. This type of bindings is useful for the , ,
and methods, to use as CommandParameter binding.
member.param: The source of the binding. If this object implements INotifyPropertyChanged and the BindingMode is OneWay or TwoWay, the target will be notified of changes to the target property.
An expression pointing to the source property. It can be a simple expression "() => [source].MyProperty" or a composed expression "() => [source].SomeObject.SomeOtherObject.SomeProperty".

The mode of the binding. OneTime means that the target property will be set once (when the binding is created) but that subsequent changes will be ignored. OneWay means that the target property will be set, and if the PropertyChanged event is raised by the source, the target property will be updated. TwoWay means that the source property will also be updated if the target raises the PropertyChanged event. Default means OneWay if only the source implements INPC, and TwoWay if both the source and the target implement INPC.
The value to use when the binding is unable to return a value. This can happen if one of the items on the Path (except the source property itself) is null, or if the Converter throws an exception.
The value used when the source property is null (or equals to default(TSource)).
member.typeparam: The type of the bound property.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Extensions.SetBinding``2(System.Object,System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0}},System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``1}},GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.BindingMode,``0,``0)
member.summary: Sets a data binding between two properties of the same object. If the source implements INotifyPropertyChanged, has observable properties and the BindingMode is OneWay or TwoWay, the target property will be notified of changes to the source property. If the target implements INotifyPropertyChanged, has observable properties and the BindingMode is TwoWay, the source will also be notified of changes to the target's properties.
member.typeparam: The type of the source property that is being databound.

The type of the target property that is being databound. If the source type is not the same as the target type, an automatic conversion will be attempted. However only simple types can be converted. For more complex conversions, use the and methods to define custom converters.
member.param: An expression pointing to the target property. It can be a simple expression "() => [target].MyProperty" or a composed expression "() => [target].SomeObject.SomeOtherObject.SomeProperty".
The source of the binding. If this object implements INotifyPropertyChanged and the BindingMode is OneWay or TwoWay, the target will be notified of changes to the target property.
An expression pointing to the source property. It can be a simple expression "() => [source].MyProperty" or a composed expression "() => [source].SomeObject.SomeOtherObject.SomeProperty".

The mode of the binding. OneTime means that the target property will be set once (when the binding is created) but that subsequent changes will be ignored. OneWay means that the target property will be set, and if the PropertyChanged event is raised by the source, the target property will be updated. TwoWay means that the source property will also be updated if the target raises the PropertyChanged event. Default means OneWay if only the source implements INPC, and TwoWay if both the source and the target implement INPC.
The value to use when the binding is unable to return a value. This can happen if one of the items on the Path (except the source property itself) is null, or if the Converter throws an exception.
The value used when the source property is null (or equals to default(TSource)).

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Extensions.SetBinding``2(System.Object,System.String,System.Object,System.String,GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.BindingMode,``0,``0)
member.summary: Sets a data binding between two properties. If the source implements INotifyPropertyChanged, the source property raises the PropertyChanged event and the BindingMode is OneWay or TwoWay, the target property will be synchronized with the source property. If the target implements INotifyPropertyChanged, the target property raises the PropertyChanged event and the BindingMode is TwoWay, the source property will also be synchronized with the target property.
member.typeparam: The type of the source property that is being databound.

The type of the target property that is being databound. If the source type is not the same as the target type, an automatic conversion will be attempted. However only simple types can be converted. For more complex conversions, use the and methods to define custom converters.
member.param: The target of the binding. If this object implements INotifyPropertyChanged and the BindingMode is TwoWay, the source will be notified of changes to the source property.
The name of the target property. This must be a simple name, without dots.
The source of the binding. If this object implements INotifyPropertyChanged and the BindingMode is OneWay or TwoWay, the target will be notified of changes to the target property.
The name of the source property. This must be a simple name, without dots.

The mode of the binding. OneTime means that the target property will be set once (when the binding is created) but that subsequent changes will be ignored. OneWay means that the target property will be set, and if the PropertyChanged event is raised by the source, the target property will be updated. TwoWay means that the source property will also be updated if the target raises the PropertyChanged event. Default means OneWay if only the source implements INPC, and TwoWay if both the source and the target implement INPC.
The value to use when the binding is unable to return a value. This can happen if one of the items on the Path (except the source property itself) is null, or if the Converter throws an exception.
The value used when the source property is null (or equals to default(TSource)).

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Extensions.SetBinding``2(System.Object,System.String,System.String,GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.BindingMode,``0,``0)
member.summary: Sets a data binding between two properties of the same object. If the source implements INotifyPropertyChanged, has observable properties and the BindingMode is OneWay or TwoWay, the target property will be notified of changes to the source property. If the target implements INotifyPropertyChanged, has observable properties and the BindingMode is TwoWay, the source will also be notified of changes to the target's properties.
member.typeparam: The type of the source property that is being databound.

The type of the target property that is being databound. If the source type is not the same as the target type, an automatic conversion will be attempted. However only simple types can be converted. For more complex conversions, use the and methods to define custom converters.
member.param: The name of the target property. This must be a simple name, without dots.
The source of the binding. If this object implements INotifyPropertyChanged and the BindingMode is OneWay or TwoWay, the target will be notified of changes to the target property.
The name of the source property. This must be a simple name, without dots.

The mode of the binding. OneTime means that the target property will be set once (when the binding is created) but that subsequent changes will be ignored. OneWay means that the target property will be set, and if the PropertyChanged event is raised by the source, the target property will be updated. TwoWay means that the source property will also be updated if the target raises the PropertyChanged event. Default means OneWay if only the source implements INPC, and TwoWay if both the source and the target implement INPC.
The value to use when the binding is unable to return a value. This can happen if one of the items on the Path (except the source property itself) is null, or if the Converter throws an exception.
The value used when the source property is null (or equals to default(TSource)).

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Extensions.SetCommand``1(System.Object,System.String,GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Command.RelayCommand{``0},GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding)
member.summary: Sets a generic RelayCommand to an object and actuates the command when a specific event is raised. This method can only be used when the event uses a standard EventHandler.
member.typeparam: The type of the CommandParameter that will be passed to the RelayCommand.
member.param: The element to which the command is added.
The name of the event that will be subscribed to to actuate the command.
The command that must be added to the element.

A Binding instance subscribed to the CommandParameter that will passed to the RelayCommand. Depending on the Binding, the CommandParameter will be observed and changes will be passed to the command, for example to update the CanExecute.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Extensions.SetCommand``2(System.Object,System.String,GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Command.RelayCommand{``0},GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding)

The command parameter that will be passed to the RelayCommand when it is executed. This is a fixed value. To pass an observable value, use one of the SetCommand overloads that uses a Binding as CommandParameter.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Extensions.SetCommand``1(System.Object,GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Command.RelayCommand{``0},GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.Binding)
member.summary: Sets a generic RelayCommand to an object and actuates the command when a specific event is raised. This method can only be used when the event uses a standard EventHandler. This method does not specify the observed event explicitly. The following events are used: - For CheckBox: CheckedChange. - For Button: Click. - At the moment, no other controls are supported. For other controls, use another SetCommand overload and specify the eventName parameter explicitly.
member.typeparam: The type of the CommandParameter that will be passed to the RelayCommand.
member.param: The element to which the command is added.
The command that must be added to the element.

A Binding instance subscribed to the CommandParameter that will passed to the RelayCommand. Depending on the Binding, the CommandParameter will be observed and changes will be passed to the command, for example to update the CanExecute.

member.name: T:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.ObservableAdapter`1
member.summary: A that can be used with an Android ListView. After setting the and the properties, the adapter is suitable for a list control. If the DataSource is an , changes to the collection will be observed and the UI will automatically be updated.
member.typeparam: The type of the items contained in the .

member.name: P:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.ObservableAdapter`1.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of items in the DataSource.

member.name: P:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.ObservableAdapter`1.DataSource
member.summary: Gets or sets the list containing the items to be represented in the list control.

member.name: P:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.ObservableAdapter`1.GetTemplateDelegate
member.summary: Gets and sets a method taking an item's position in the list, the item itself, and a recycled Android View, and returning an adapted View for this item. Note that the recycled view might be null, in which case a new View must be inflated by this method.

member.name: P:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.ObservableAdapter`1.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the item corresponding to the index in the DataSource.
member.param: The index of the item that needs to be returned.
member.returns: The item corresponding to the index in the DataSource

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.ObservableAdapter`1.GetItemId(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a unique ID for the item corresponding to the position parameter. In this implementation, the method always returns the position itself.
member.param: The position of the item for which the ID needs to be returned.
member.returns: A unique ID for the item corresponding to the position parameter.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Helpers.ObservableAdapter`1.GetView(System.Int32,Android.Views.View,Android.Views.ViewGroup)
member.summary: Prepares the view (template) for the item corresponding to the position in the DataSource. This method calls the method so that the caller can create (if necessary) and adapt the template for the corresponding item.
member.param: The position of the item in the DataSource.
A recycled view. If this parameter is null, a new view must be inflated.
The view's parent.
member.returns: A view adapted for the item at the corresponding position.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Threading.DispatcherHelper.CheckBeginInvokeOnUI(System.Action)
member.summary: Executes an action on the UI thread. If this method is called from the UI thread, the action is executed immendiately. If the method is called from another thread, the action will be enqueued on the UI thread's dispatcher and executed asynchronously.
member.param: The action that will be executed on the UI thread.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Threading.DispatcherHelper.Initialize
member.summary: This method is only here for compatibility with other platforms but it doesn't do anything.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Threading.DispatcherHelper.Reset
member.summary: This method is only here for compatibility with other platforms but it doesn't do anything.

member.name: T:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Views.DialogService
member.summary: An implementation of allowing to display simple dialogs to the user. Note that this class uses the built in Android dialogs which may or may not be sufficient for your needs. Using this class is easy but feel free to develop your own IDialogService implementation if needed.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Views.DialogService.ShowError(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Action)
member.summary: Displays information about an error.
member.param: The message to be shown to the user.
The title of the dialog box. This may be null.
The text shown in the only button in the dialog box. If left null, the text "OK" will be used.
A callback that should be executed after the dialog box is closed by the user.
member.returns: A Task allowing this async method to be awaited.
member.remarks: Displaying dialogs in Android is synchronous. As such, this method will be executed synchronously even though it can be awaited for cross-platform compatibility purposes.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Views.DialogService.ShowError(System.Exception,System.String,System.String,System.Action)
member.summary: Displays information about an error.
member.param: The exception of which the message must be shown to the user.
The title of the dialog box. This may be null.
The text shown in the only button in the dialog box. If left null, the text "OK" will be used.
A callback that should be executed after the dialog box is closed by the user.
member.returns: A Task allowing this async method to be awaited.
member.remarks: Displaying dialogs in Android is synchronous. As such, this method will be executed synchronously even though it can be awaited for cross-platform compatibility purposes.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Views.DialogService.ShowMessage(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Displays information to the user. The dialog box will have only one button with the text "OK".
member.param: The message to be shown to the user.
The title of the dialog box. This may be null.
member.returns: A Task allowing this async method to be awaited.
member.remarks: Displaying dialogs in Android is synchronous. As such, this method will be executed synchronously even though it can be awaited for cross-platform compatibility purposes.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Views.DialogService.ShowMessage(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Action)
member.summary: Displays information to the user. The dialog box will have only one button.
member.param: The message to be shown to the user.
The title of the dialog box. This may be null.
The text shown in the only button in the dialog box. If left null, the text "OK" will be used.
A callback that should be executed after the dialog box is closed by the user.
member.returns: A Task allowing this async method to be awaited.
member.remarks: Displaying dialogs in Android is synchronous. As such, this method will be executed synchronously even though it can be awaited for cross-platform compatibility purposes.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Views.DialogService.ShowMessage(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Action{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Displays information to the user. The dialog box will have only one button.
member.param: The message to be shown to the user.
The title of the dialog box. This may be null.
The text shown in the "confirm" button in the dialog box. If left null, the text "OK" will be used.
The text shown in the "cancel" button in the dialog box. If left null, the text "Cancel" will be used.

A callback that should be executed after the dialog box is closed by the user. The callback method will get a boolean parameter indicating if the "confirm" button (true) or the "cancel" button (false) was pressed by the user.
member.returns: A Task allowing this async method to be awaited. The task will return true or false depending on the dialog result.
member.remarks: Displaying dialogs in Android is synchronous. As such, this method will be executed synchronously even though it can be awaited for cross-platform compatibility purposes.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Views.DialogService.ShowMessageBox(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Displays information to the user in a simple dialog box. The dialog box will have only one button with the text "OK". This method should be used for debugging purposes.
member.param: The message to be shown to the user.
The title of the dialog box. This may be null.
member.returns: A Task allowing this async method to be awaited.
member.remarks: Displaying dialogs in Android is synchronous. As such, this method will be executed synchronously even though it can be awaited for cross-platform compatibility purposes.

member.name: T:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Views.NavigationService
member.summary: Xamarin Android implementation of . This implementation can be used in Xamarin Android applications (not Xamarin Forms).
member.remarks: For this navigation service to work properly, your Activities should derive from the class.

member.summary: The key that is returned by the property when the current Activiy is the root activity.

member.name: P:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Views.NavigationService.CurrentPageKey
member.summary: The key corresponding to the currently displayed page.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Views.NavigationService.Configure(System.String,System.Type)
member.summary: Adds a key/page pair to the navigation service.
member.remarks: For this navigation service to work properly, your Activities should derive from the class.
member.param: The key that will be used later in the or methods.
The type of the activity (page) corresponding to the key.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Views.NavigationService.GetAndRemoveParameter(Android.Content.Intent)
member.summary: Allows a caller to get the navigation parameter corresponding to the Intent parameter.
member.param: The of the navigated page.
member.returns: The navigation parameter. If no parameter is found, returns null.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Views.NavigationService.GetAndRemoveParameter``1(Android.Content.Intent)
member.summary: Allows a caller to get the navigation parameter corresponding to the Intent parameter.
member.typeparam: The type of the retrieved parameter.
member.param: The of the navigated page.
member.returns: The navigation parameter casted to the proper type. If no parameter is found, returns default(T).

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Views.NavigationService.GoBack
member.summary: If possible, discards the current page and displays the previous page on the navigation stack.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Views.NavigationService.NavigateTo(System.String)
member.summary: Displays a new page corresponding to the given key. Make sure to call the method first.
member.param: The key corresponding to the page that should be displayed.
member.exception: When this method is called for a key that has not been configured earlier.

member.name: M:GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Views.NavigationService.NavigateTo(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Displays a new page corresponding to the given key, and passes a parameter to the new page. Make sure to call the method first.
member.param: The key corresponding to the page that should be displayed.
The parameter that should be passed to the new page.
member.exception: When this method is called for a key that has not been configured earlier.

member.name: T:System.Windows.IWeakEventListener
member.summary: Provides event listening support for classes that expect to receive events through the WeakEvent pattern and a WeakEventManager.

member.name: P:System.Windows.IWeakEventListener.InstanceReference
member.summary: Gets the WeakReference holding the instance that raised the event.

member.name: M:System.Windows.IWeakEventListener.ReceiveWeakEvent(System.Type,System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Receives events from the centralized event manager.
member.param: The type of the WeakEventManager calling this method.
Object that originated the event.
Event data.
member.returns: true if the listener handled the event. It is considered an error by the WeakEventManager handling in WPF to register a listener for an event that the listener does not handle. Regardless, the method should return false if it receives an event that it does not recognize or handle.

member.name: T:System.Windows.PropertyChangedEventManager
member.summary: Provides an implementation so that you can use the "weak event listener" pattern to attach listeners for the event.

member.name: P:System.Windows.PropertyChangedEventManager.Instance
member.summary: Get the current instance of

member.name: M:System.Windows.PropertyChangedEventManager.AddListener(System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged,System.Windows.IWeakEventListener,System.String)
member.summary: Adds the specified listener to the list of listeners on the specified source.
member.param: The object with the event.
The object to add as a listener.
The name of the property that exists on source upon which to listen for changes.

member.name: M:System.Windows.PropertyChangedEventManager.RemoveListener(System.Windows.IWeakEventListener)
member.summary: Removes the specified listener from the list of listeners on the specified source.
member.param: The object to remove as a listener.

member.name: M:System.Windows.PropertyChangedEventManager.PrivateAddListener(System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged,System.Windows.IWeakEventListener,System.String)
member.summary: Private method to add the specified listener to the list of listeners on the specified source.
member.param: The object with the event.
The object to add as a listener.
The name of the property that exists on source upon which to listen for changes.

member.name: M:System.Windows.PropertyChangedEventManager.PrivateRemoveListener(System.Windows.IWeakEventListener)
member.summary: Private method to remove the specified listener from the list of listeners on the specified source.
member.param: The object to remove as a listener.

member.summary: The method that handles the event.
member.param: The source of the event.
A that contains the event data.

member.name: M:System.Windows.PropertyChangedEventManager.StartListening(System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged)
member.summary: Begin listening for the event on the provided source.
member.param: The object on which to start listening for .

member.name: M:System.Windows.PropertyChangedEventManager.StopListening(System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged)
member.summary: Stop listening for the event on the provided source.
